column4: I just installed xfce4 but gnomes session manager dosn't see it how can I start up xfce4 instead of gnome??
errm, have you got the xubuntu-desktop package installed?
I'm pretty sure I did a sudo apt-get install xubuntu-desktop
well, verify that it is indeed installed -- dpkg -l | grep -i xubuntu
that command returns nothing but when I do an slocate xubuntu it returns lots
errm, if that command returns nothing, it's likely the package isnt installed
hmmm thats odd because I just went through my command history and sudo apt-get install xubuntu-desktop is in there and I don't remember seeing any errors on its completion
and you sure the GDM has no entry for XFCE?
nope just GNOME failsafe gnome and failsafe xterm
does locate/slocate find you a xfce.desktop file?
negative, but all the friggin icons and language packs for xfce are installed
if you installed xfce since the last updatedb .. you'll need to run it again
lol well the install just finished 5 minutes ago I guess I could just try it again
run updatedb and then try locate again
